data.title: Hamilton Library Ann Smith, Author at Hamilton Library
data.text:
Semester Hours

Spring Semester hours begin Wednesday, January 31 at 7:30am and continue through the semester. View spring semester hours. Read More →

Ebook Central Grows to 250,000+

More than 2,300 ebooks have recently been added to our Ebook Central collection bringing the total collection to more than 250,000 ebook titles. Additionally, 41% of all new titles were published in the last three years. Explore Ebook Central by clicking here. Read More →

CIAO Adds 30 eBooks

Thirty ebooks have been added to the Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO) collection. Joining a collection of working papers, policy briefs, commentary/analysis, and special reports, these Columbia University Press ebooks address topics in international politics,... Read More →

TEDTalks OnDemand

Approximately 875 TEDTalks videos are now available for streaming through Films on Demand. Browse the TED list, or search your topic/title of interest. Chrome, Firefox, and Safari are recommended for best viewing. Click here to check out the list. Read More →

HeinOnline – TRIAL

Explore case law, statutes, and journal articles. Browse presidential libraries, treaties, state/federal codes, and more. The library has trial access to HeinOnline through June 30, 2018. Access HeinOnline here. Share your thoughts and/or questions about HeinOnline with us... Read More →

NexisUni Replaces LexisNexis Academic

Lexis Nexis Academic has a new name – Nexis Uni. Find full-text articles from more than 15,000 news, business, and legal sources, US and international. Retrieve legal cases, including US Supreme Court decisions dating back to 1790. Browse company information, including... Read More →

NEW eVideo Titles

Recently, 197 NEW streaming video clips were added to our Films on Demand collection. Browse these titles through this link. Read More →
